mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Relates efforts by Jefferson to withdraw Short's assets from the latter's bank, which had failed; Jefferson assures Short that he will be repaid by the bank; shares his eagerness about retiring on October 1; admits he has no idea who will succeed him or what the prospects are for Short's future diplomatic employment; informs him that Jefferson is considering "tenanting" the land in Virginia.
mdRecord.dcterms:subject: Jefferson, Thomas, 1743-1826--Correspondence
mdRecord.dcterms:title: Letter, 1793 July 11, Philadelphia, [Pennsylvania] to [William Short], n.p.
